entrance.title: Entrance Hall
highlights: Welcome area with a grand overview of the museum’s sections.

classic.title: Classical Paintings Room
highlights: Home to masterpieces from the Renaissance and Baroque periods.
Rich in historical and religious symbolism.

modern.title: Modern / Abstract Room
highlights: Features 19th–20th century works exploring expression, emotion, and form.
Includes Impressionist, Surrealist, and Expressionist art.

sculpture.title: Sculpture Hall
highlights: Marble, bronze, and modern sculptures displayed under soft lighting.

landscape.title: Landscape Gallery
highlights: Dedicated to nature-inspired artworks across all centuries.

mona lisa.title: Mona Lisa
mona lisa.summary: The most famous portrait in the world, celebrated for the sitter’s enigmatic smile and Leonardo’s mastery of light and shadow.

the last supper.title: The Last Supper
the last supper.summary: Depicts Christ and his disciples during their final meal, capturing dramatic emotion and divine composition.

girl with a pearl earring.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
girl with a pearl earring.summary: Sometimes called the Dutch Mona Lisa, admired for its intimacy and Vermeer’s mastery of light.

birth of venus.title: The Birth of Venus
birth of venus.summary: Depicts the goddess Venus emerging from the sea, symbolizing beauty and divine love in Renaissance art.

the night watch.title: The Night Watch
the night watch.summary: A dynamic group portrait capturing civic guardsmen in motion, showcasing Rembrandt’s dramatic use of light.

starry night.title: The Starry Night
starry night.summary: A swirling night sky over Saint-Rémy, expressing deep emotion through color, rhythm, and movement.

the scream.title: The Scream
the scream.summary: An icon of modern art that captures existential anxiety with haunting intensity.

guernica.title: Guernica
guernica.summary: A monumental anti-war mural depicting the tragedies of the Spanish Civil War through fragmented cubist forms.

the persistence of memory.title: The Persistence of Memory
the persistence of memory.summary: Surrealist masterpiece known for its melting clocks, exploring time, dreams, and subconscious perception.

the kiss.title: The Kiss
the kiss.medium: Oil and gold leaf on canvas
the kiss.summary: Celebrates love and intimacy through gold patterns and flowing, abstract forms.

american gothic.title: American Gothic
american gothic.summary: Depicts a farmer and his daughter before a rural home—an icon of American realism and resilience.

water lilies.title: Water Lilies
water lilies.summary: Monet’s luminous depiction of his garden pond, dissolving reflection and depth into pure color.
